qas.question: What is the function of the Royal Institute's Visiting Boards?

answers.text: to assess courses for exemption from the RIBA's examinations in architecture

qas.question: When did the Royal Institute and ARB reach accord on a shared body of criteria?
What is a key difference between the ARB and Royal Institute?

answers.text: RIBA also validates courses outside the UK

plausible_answers.text: to assess courses for exemption from the RIBA's examinations in architecture

qas.question: What is no longer the function of the Royal Institute's Visiting Boards?
When did the Royal Institute and ARB reach accord on a conflicted body of criteria?
What does ARB no longer stand for?

plausible_answers.text: RIBA also validates courses outside the UK

qas.question: What is a key similarity between the ARB and Royal Institute?

context: RIBA Visiting Boards continue <a0_0><b4_0>to assess courses for exemption from the RIBA's examinations in architecture<b4_0/><a0_0/>. Under arrangements made in <a1_0><b5_0>2011<b5_0/><a1_0/> the validation criteria are jointly held by the RIBA and the <a2_0><b6_0>Architects Registration Board<b6_0/><a2_0/>, but unlike the ARB, the <a3_0><b7_0>RIBA also validates courses outside the UK<b7_0/><a3_0/>.
